context: The word 'läheks' is the third-person singular form of the Estonian verb 'minema' (to go) in the conditional mood. It means 'would go', 'should go', or 'might go'. In conditional sentences, it expresses a hypothetical action that depends on some condition being met. For example: 'Kui sa tulksid siis ma läheks sinuga.' - 'If you came then I would go with you.'
